name: Overview
data: [{"id":"7ff79086-01a2-452a-ac72-bef1b6462455","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Group: Structural Foundations (Static Architecture)","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"e2b25a6a-feef-44db-9b0e-e6dabb88d9dd","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"The ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"Structural Foundations","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" group contains the essential modules that map the physical and logical architecture of the project under analysis. Before Jarvis can trace data flow or detect vulnerabilities, it must first build a \"blueprint\" of the codebase.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"dc3bb039-dd69-402f-ad85-4f394e842a7a","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"These modules transform raw source files into a navigable hierarchy of modules, classes, and scopes, allowing the analysis engine to understand exactly where it is in the project and how different code entities relate to one another.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"5308caf0-b099-4fcf-aa81-3b4c85aa4e15","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"bb116a87-3c61-4a5d-b1cc-021211c67777","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Included Modules","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"cf08d334-45f8-458b-b841-c771db477948","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":4,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"classes.py","styles":{"code":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"9123140a-4a1b-4c4a-9959-82f11a6c380f","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"This module models the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"Object-Oriented (OO)","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" landscape of the project. It defines the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"ClassNode","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"ClassManager","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", which track class definitions and inheritance hierarchies. Its primary role is reconstructing the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"Method Resolution Order (MRO)","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":", which allows the engine to correctly identify which parent class provides a specific method or attribute.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"d59ff91b-aa3d-4507-baa5-2019a44f1e38","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":4,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"modules.py","styles":{"code":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"15d847b5-a438-46db-9c9e-6d1289705821","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"The ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"Registry of Files","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":". This module manages the distinction between ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"Internal","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" source code (the files being scanned) and ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"External","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" dependencies (third-party libraries). It catalogs the \"Table of Contents\" for every file, including the line ranges for every function and method defined within them.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"71a0c34a-b177-488b-97e5-339356be9a04","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":4,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"nodes.py","styles":{"code":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"02511718-eb9b-4b0d-92b5-a5e460b68f77","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"The ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"AST Address Book","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":". It maintains a mapping between symbolic namespaces (like ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"auth.login","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":") and their physical Abstract Syntax Tree (AST) nodes. This allows the analyzer to instantly \"jump\" to the actual source code logic of any function or class encountered during the scan.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"62de2943-053a-41f1-b0a1-546089a273c3","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":4,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"scopes.py","styles":{"code":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"e91abd61-539a-4669-8919-e673793802c8","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"This module manages the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"Lexical Hierarchy","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":". It tracks the nesting of functions, classes, and blocks, ensuring that variables are resolved according to Python’s scoping rules (LEGB). It prevents variable name collisions by keeping \"local\" variables isolated within their respective functional boundaries.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"8f07214b-00cc-4ff7-a568-8343d51b084f","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":4,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"imports.py","styles":{"code":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"0bbb27c4-0a5c-43c9-958c-458059c349a4","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"The ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"Dependency Mapper","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":". It analyzes ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"import","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" statements and dynamic loading to build an ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"Import Graph","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":". This helps Jarvis understand the interconnectedness of different files, ensuring that when a module is used, the engine knows which source file to resolve it from.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"00478ef1-abc0-4618-ba25-b8ccf15cf712","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"5b819a13-d4de-43e2-be28-5150ee3db19e","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Group Purpose and Relationship","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"9dd8672c-a5bd-4bde-be69-d01ee99ed655","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Together, these modules provide the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"Static Context","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" for the analysis:","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"8f245600-da6d-44fe-98d7-bc6a1e4768d6","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Navigation","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": They turn the codebase into a searchable graph, enabling the engine to move from a call site in File A to a definition in File B.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"65c2f423-1de6-4841-8c1f-3b6e88267fca","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Resolution","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": They provide the rules for looking up symbols, ensuring that ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"self.data","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is resolved via the class hierarchy (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"classes.py","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":") while ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"local_data","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is resolved via the lexical scope (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"scopes.py","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":").","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"638adfaa-2bb6-4704-972f-9f1f742e6ff5","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Scope & Boundary","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": They define the limits of the analysis, helping the engine decide whether to \"step into\" a project file or treat a third-party module as a black box.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"3eed6c3a-8f07-45de-878f-bb2345b2981e","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[],"children":[]}]
